definition: to cause trouble
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]

sentences.english: QinQiong oxidase recall advice yourself not to ask for something.
sentences.chinese: 秦瓊回想李靖勸告自己不要惹事。

sentences.english: This is my bad day, you had to stir up trouble.
sentences.chinese: 這兩天是我不好，給你惹事了。

sentences.english: During childhood, everybody requires that you be obedient and not stir up trouble.
sentences.chinese: 童年時代，所有的人都要求你聽話，不惹事。

sentences.english: Have crybaby clients and lawyers led Lady Justice astray?
sentences.chinese: 那些惹事的顧客和律師讓正義女神蒙羞？

sentences.english: Some people get aggressive after drinking spirits.
sentences.chinese: 有些人酒後愛尋釁惹事。

sentences.english: The school wishes to BE disembarrassed of the troublesome boy.
sentences.chinese: 校方希望擺脫這個惹事生非的孩子。

sentences.english: You know, playing football in the dirt, getting in trouble, all the stupid things we did.
sentences.chinese: 在泥地裏踢足球，惹事生非，我們做過的所有蠢事。

sentences.english: He got into trouble with the police.
sentences.chinese: 他惹事落到了警方手裏。

sentences.english: Don't speak in such a manner, or you'll get into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 不要這樣講話，否則會惹事生非的。

sentences.english: Mr. Lin's childhood was spent fooling around and getting into scrapes.
sentences.chinese: 林先生的童年是在虛混時光及惹事生非中度過的。

definition: to stir up trouble
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to create difficulties/to invite trouble/to be troublesome
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
to look for trouble
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to provoke/to tease
to stir up trouble/to get into trouble
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
timid/to be afraid of getting involved/to be afraid of getting into trouble
to make a mess of sth
to stir up trouble
meddling in other people's business
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to meddle/to be a "nosy Parker"/to be too inquisitive about other people's business
